title: Is the guitar solo from ‘Hotel California’ the best of all time? Why or why not? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. Even subjectively it is not. But it is a really great melody that tells a story, critical to great solos. I also like the solo in “Love Reign O’er Me” by the Who. And everyone will remind us of the “Comfortably Numb” outro solo by Pink Floyd. But you have to give a nod to “Rock Around The Clock” by Bill Haley and the Comets, “That’ll Be The Day” by Buddy Holly and, of course, “Johnny B. Goode” by Chuck Berry. Best of all time means different things to different people. And it doesn’t have to mean technically amazing, either. One of the best solo sections I would mention doesn’t even involve a guitar, but a violin. The song is “White Bird” by It’s A Beautiful Day. The solo section in this song is just brilliant. An amazing song in the pantheon of rock and roll. The outro solo to “Closer To Home” by Grand Funk is really beautiful, and simple, and perfect. Not trying to impress anyone at all, but just creating a wonderful tapestry over the accompaniment. Another amazing solo is on the song “Peak Hour” by the Moody Blues from ‘Days Of Future Past’. Just a whole lot of fun and good energy, perfect fit for this tune. You really have to think about questions like this because, at least for me, it involves more than just technical wizardry. Of course there are more great solos I haven’t mentioned. But this gives you an idea where I stand on the question.

Yes. The dueling guitars of Don Felder and Joe Walsh is one of the greatest guitar finales to any rock song, period. It was recorded in the control room of Criteria Studios in Miami over three days. Producer Bill Szymczyk called it the highlight of his career. Felder starts it, followed by Walsh, then they trade short solos before capping it with the harmony arpeggios. Well thought out, immaculately played, and perfect. Interestingly, I like the spanish guitar version on the live Hell Freezes Over album at least as well. It’s very clear on both recordings who the better guitarist is. Don Felder was and is a monster. Joe was great, but couldn’t carry Felder’s guitar case. It’s unfortunate that Felder and the Eagles parted ways. In some ways, they haven’t really been the same band since.
